Quick Facts

EXIT   X

HEALTH AND SAFETY AT WORK

Page

Table of Contents

 

Victoria  

 

Although this duty does not strictly exist in Victoria, Victorian employers are advised to adopt an approach that endorses consulting, coordinating and cooperating with other duty holders.

 

If a number of people share a duty to the same matter then they must, so far as is reasonably practicable, address that duty together by consulting, cooperating and coordinating with each other.

 

For example, there may be many principal contractors performing work at a building site. Each principal contractor, as well as any sub-contractors engaged by them, is likely to owe duties as a PCBU in relation to workers. Where their duties overlap, each of the principal contractors should consult with each other about the work being performed, cooperate to ensure they work together and coordinate their activities so that they work safely together.

Victoria
